bow: at the end of my rope with potty training she is almost years old and refuses to let her diapers go desperate for help have tried absolutely every trick in the book to get this kid to stop using diapers rewards punishment not physical do worry but taking toy away or something reading on the toilet using my phone on the toilet keeping her in there the whole time until she goes etc going insane she knows perfectly well what the toilet is for and knows she ll be big girl if she uses it but she so damn stubborn she will hold in her pee until it hurts and she will cry ll leave her diaperless and she will eventually scream like crazy to have diaper because the pee pee is coming out in the year we have been potty training her she has only peed times and pooed times in the toilet does anyone anywhere out there have relatable experience does anyone out there have tips know people say things like do worry it not like she will be wearing diapers in college but honestly think at this point she will be maybe it time for cruel to be kind scenario barricade yourself in the house throw away any nappies and let her scream if you give in every time she will keep screaming because it works if she pees everywhere few times its not the end of the world she will probably realise pretty quickly that it better to go on the toilet then wet herself would load up on bribery seriously no shame in that stickers chocolate whatever it takes get some big girl knickers choose couple of days that you do need to go out and just go for it it will be awful at the start for sure but worth it in the long run good luck edit just thought have you got one of the smaller seats that fit on to the regular toilet seat this helped loads for my girls because they felt like they were going to fall in the big toilet thank you for the reassurance need all the luck can get do have one of those potty seats really like it do know if this will be helpful we went through similar but at different age so she may not respond we left the potty in the living room let her decorate it with stickers sat her favorite toy in it and pretended the toy was going potty bribed just sitting on the potty with chocolates also read the once upon potty book nonstop made massive big deal out of every small step ran around the house singing with dirty potty the first time she used it we also used pull ups so she could get them on and off herself good luck to you it never easy for any kid agree that it time for some tough love here do shame or berate her but focus on the fact that potty usage is simply expected behavior now and that messy wet clothes are the natural consequence of not following that behavior diapers are no longer an option have her pick out her own big kid underwear pick few days you can stay home and settle in for the long haul no diapers none in the house they are gone if pee is coming out it is coming out she can decide if it goes all over her clothes or in the potty because she big girl have whole list of fun things to do outside the house like the park or library or friend house or whatever and talk about them all the time of course she too big for diapers now so these places will not allow her to visit until she can use the potty offer rewards but lay them out in the beginning you get every time you pee and every time you poop and stick with them do not start pleading and offering more stuff just stand firm and show crazy pride at every success stay as calm as you can and stand firm it is so frustrating for all of us but you re going to get there you said you have potty seat but do you also have stool dangling feet can sometimes make it physically difficult to go especially poop good luck you got this did even try bought trainer toilet and underwear and stuff and would ask him if he wanted to go one day after he turned he just started and never stopped we ve had zero poop accidents but sometimes he is too tired and lazy to get out of bed so we have pee incident like once every couple months my advice is to let off the pressure she really wo go to college in diapers stop for while we tried everything with my son even took him to counsler she talked to him about bodies work while coloring then we just let the while thing go he figured it out few months after you re the grownup just stop buying diapers that what did sure my kid peed on the floor couple times but it was long before the potty was better than peeing on themselves of course mine was our trick was the weeks leading up to her birthday we told her if she did stop wearing diapers and start wearing panties and keeping them dry then she would turn and we would have to take all the presents back and her baby sister would grow bigger than her ect ect then set certain tone to an alarm and told her every time we heard that sound we were just going to try and sit on the toilet and would set the alarm for every 30 minutes if she went pee or poop 15 if she did sometimes she fought going but we told her the choice was sit on the toilet or she would turn that way the decision was hers in previous potty training session we had shown her youtube videos of some favorite characters potty training daniel tiger elmo hello kitty and video that talked about how constipation is bad and kinda showed how food travels through the system as poop and it unhealthy and you can get sick if you do poop someone on reddit had mentioned telling your child that the poop and pee gets flushed to the ocean and feeds the fishes we told her that and it sorta interested her we also took the lid off the tank and flushed to show her what the scary noise was read about potty training strong willed child and it helped remind me that my frustrations only steel her stubbornness more in the end it was easy once she found her personal motivation you know one thing we have tried is using literal potty we have the toilet seat kind will try this thank you excellent advice so motivated now thank you so much thank you every bit of motivation helps so much thanks yeah we did stop for good while and only started again about month ago it really is so draining does she show any signs of sensory issues ve just begun learning about them but it something to look into with such an extreme situation very true what hard is that she has baby brother who wears the same size diapers as her if she gets her hands on diaper she ll just put it on herself seriously going to do super lock down on his diapers thank you great advice this is very helpful will try these ideas out most of them have even heard of actually yes for about month now she been having problems with loud noises this is whole other thing that concerning me she actually has dr appointment tomorrow for it do you give in and give her diaper when she screams my niece at five would hold her poop in until after school she come home and throw fit for diaper daddy would give in and she poop in it throw away the diapers it time to get tough as long as she has no physical problems have you seen her pediatrician for this and remove the diaper as an option you re in charge be kind but firm no diapers she ll probably have all manner of accidents and that ok if you re consistent she will learn to use the potty sometimes it takes hours and hours until give in and give her diaper but you re right should give in at all just worry about if holding her pee or poo in is damaging for her thanks for the advice diapers no longer exist if she asks you ran out the store does have any whatever white lie you need to say she is capable of using the potty if she holds her pee until it hurts my late potty trainer did that also make the bathroom fun place maybe the only time she can watch videos on your phone is when she sitting on the potty have you tried getting pretty panties with character or something she like tell her she has to keep them dry need to do this with my son soon 25yrs old but the whole carpeted house thing scares me ve watched my older sister and her husband absolutely struggle with virtually the same situation they always gave in and they never listened to me in fact their two girls now ages and still wear pull ups at times implore you to please please be consistent and do give in no matter what do even give her pull ups that just another diaper ve got two girls ages and and my older one was potty trained at and my younger one at about so my methods have worked really well for me it sucks when they pee on the couch or when they just stand there and it runs down their legs it is fun or quick or easy but they will get it eventually it just takes time hang in there momma you ve got this you re so right okay starting this tomorrow after her doctor appointment thank you yeah did try that no luck one trick know of is buying her diapers in couple sizes too small and put them on and say oh no your diapers do fit anymore looks like you ll have to start using the potty etc my niece was the same age and being really stubborn but it was her preschool that finally got her when the kids become potty trained they move up to the next class all her friends were moving on and she finally was ready in the midst of potty training my son right now but getting rid of his pacifier was tough he was really attached tried taking it away cold turkey because that what everyone always says to do but it was disaster realized needed different approach noticed that sometimes he really pays attention to what say to him also realized his pacifier provided comfort and security and that he was going to need time to process letting go of them so prepped him for month about how pacifiers are special helpers that come to help babies sleep and when you turn they go back to pacifier land because you re big boy and do need them anywhere reminded him every day for month or so until came home with toys and lollipop and balloon he turned in his pacifiers for the toys and lollipops he said goodbye to the pacifiers and we tied them to the balloons and watched them go bye bye and he never asked for pacifier again and was fine maybe you could do something similar with your daughter her diapers may provide sense of security for her and letting go of the may be really scary for her let her know that her time with diapers is coming to an end and let her enjoy her last few weeks with her diapers and just keep reminding her of what coming up that diapers are for babies who ca use the potty and now that she big girl she does need them anymore and the diapers go bye bye then she can trade her diapers for big girl undies and some treats and you can go from there lots of good advice in this thread will be saving good luck very neat ideas that clever approach thanks so much for taking the time to do this this thread is helping my motivation lot toddlers can make you crazy ca they plus another baby poor you reiterate good luck do forget to breathe no problem if you need any help or support or advice please feel free to pm me you re not alone you are absolutely right that excessive holding it can cause physical problems especially for small children would strongly urge you to talk to your kids pediatrician about this concern before taking any internet advice my daughter is about and half 95th percentile for height and weight and still in diapers your story resonated with me lot too have tried treat rewards sticker charts consistent reminders yada yada but she simply cries if withhold diapers from her however here how have made peace with the process constantly remind myself that she little that her world is big and scary that she had to cope with several major life changes in the past year move sibling and disabled mother that where she pees poops is one area that she can exert some control and that diapers feel safe to her she is almost clone of her 10yo cousin and he too was almost before he potty trained his mother reassures me that one night he simply refused to wear diaper saying he did need them anymore and never had an accident after that even at night my daughter is starting preschool next month and believe that the peer pressure might just encourage the process along but ve resolved that other than talking *non judgmentally* about body functions in general and pointing out when others use the restroom not going to push her if she gets uti from holding it because she scared to go anywhere but in diaper that will only delay the process and potentially make her even more fearful of urinating hate to be the reason she gets uti hate making her miserable while potty training ve heard people say that every kid will potty train in their own time and you ca force it wonder if that actually true do take my advice too seriously because have no personal experience with this but saw you mention she takes her younger sibling diaper and puts it on herself can she also take it off can you teach her how to wipe and put on diaper cream then put the dirty diaper in the trash and wash her hands maybe taking care of her own diapering as much as she can could be an intermediate step to using the toilet once she realizes it lot less work to just go there either way you re done changing her diaper because she big girl now lt crazy idea gt it sounds like crazy idea but you are right she could that she takes them off if they are full of pee and she will put it in the washroom and let me know it is something to think about yes agree at she will escalate the screaming until you break the trick is to not break would spend the weekend inside no diapers just the potty if she doesnt pee on the potty then she pees her pants if she keeps peeing her pants then you tell her you cant go anywhere outside until she stops peeing her pants because there are no more diapers reward the good behaviour but dont go too crazy just simple reward that you can keep delivering tbh stick with non food reward stickers or something just do like the idea of instilling all the food as reward connotations you ve got to call the lady at readysetgopotty com think her name is sally neuberger went to seminar of hers and used her method and it went really well she also does paid phone consultations she know everything and has seen everything http readysetgopotty com about the potty coach think it control thing for my daughter anyway not that she would put it in those terms her world feels unpredictable but no one but her can decide when and where to pee she will use the potty when she feels it is safe to do so and when the right incentive is in place which could be as simple as the desire to be like the other kids at preschool spend so much time teaching my daughters that their bodies are their own feel that this is one area where could really screw up by pushing too hard okay can do that hope never heard of this thanks for the link agree throw out the diapers and do go back have also heard of letting them clean help clean up their messes and that helps them see the consequence no other negative reinforcement outside of cleaning it up idk good luck would advise that you do things on her terms until you sort out the sensory situation you might be inadvertently working backward it possible that pediatric occupational therapist would be able to help you ours was stubborn too she would potty train until after she was three years old she would pee on the little potty once or twice but then decide she did like it and absolutely refuse to go ever again finally three months after she turned three he dad got frustrated and yelled he told her she was coming out of the bathroom until she finished peeing in the potty few minutes later she came out and said daddy daddy peed in the potty we left diapers behind that day however the battle was only half over she has serious aversion to public toilets because of the noise level she is an hsp highly sensitive person and some sounds physically hurt so even at she is wary of some public restrooms until she was about she would go in any public toilets at all and that really hampered our ability to travel so one day we went on day trip started out in the morning and did come home until that evening she had several opportunities to pee but refused on the way home she complained she had to pee and we had to hurry home there was part of the high way that is very bumpy so my husband slowed down bit she was crying and saying faster daddy finally smelled little pee from the back seat the first gas station was came to picked her up carried her inside and sat her firmly on the toilet despite her crying protestations she could hold it in any longer and out came really long stream of urine praised her and she realized it really was that bad she still got that noise sensitivity going on but she will pee in public because she understands the consequences of not going sometimes you have to put the kid into situation where she has no choice but to either wet herself or use toilet either way the kid learns lesson first solidarity our son was nearly before he was trained too combination of extremely stubborn with wanting to do everything himself perfectly it took motivation of knowing he had to be potty trained before going to school not allowed any tv or ipad unless he was physically on potty naked from the waist down for couple days before he got it the thing with him was that he would not ask for help so no pants was essential not only for learning ques that he had to pee but also so that he could go and not have to ask for help with pants he still in pants with no buttons zippers snaps because he still wo ask for help visited new neighbors brought the seat for the toilet for him when he had to go he snuck off by himself got the seat used it perfectly but left his pants in the bathroom and came dancing into the room buck naked anyway really hope something clicks for your daughter soon know how frustrating it is my daughter is exactly the same way check out the book the highly sensitive person posted above about my daughter aversion to toilets it turns out that these types of noises physically hurt highly sensitive people on the one hand she knew she needed to get potty trained but on the other hand she was afraid of the noise we finally got her trained she now and do check out public restrooms and let her know if it single toilet restroom with quiet flush the automatic hand dryers are the devil spawn and the auto flush toilets are the worst also she has specific toilets in town that she prefers because they re familiar and quiet if you have to run errands and know you ll be out for while be sure to stop by those places you will be surprised at the choices she makes my daughter prefers the bathrooms in the oldest supermarket in town with ancient toilets because they are quiet whereas she will absolutely never set foot in fancy schmancy mcdonald or walmart bathroom because of the loud echoey noises in them you ve probably also noticed some other sensory issues like spinning and higher than normal level of activeness if that the case she probably also sensory seeker and just because she succeeds in doing something once does mean she ll do it again on her own my daughter pulled her own tooth out month ago but refuses to pull the second one out even though she knows it wo hurt and there wo be much blood that tooth is barely in there but she leaves it alone even with the knowledge that the tooth fairy will reward her so pick your battles in that regard did something similar with my daughter concerning her sippy cup she was using it to fall asleep we told her that now she was getting to be big girl she would have to stop because big girls do use sippy cups it was remarkably easy to get her to stop using it these are excellent things to consider you ve given me lot to think about thank you so much ve been reading that pull ups actually hinder potty training because the diapers absorb so much she feels like she got to go and she wo feel wet when she does that swear by potty treats and they worked for children you buy some small candies amp jelly beans gummy bears or something similar you it is visibly take one for yourself when you go visibly enjoy it do not share with the child you only get potty treat when you go in the potty she will catch on very quickly right now it looks like she would rather be in diapers like the baby go ahead and put her in diapers pretend not to care but the baby does get to eat jelly beans now does he he does go in the potty refuse to share unless she goes in the potty and she will rapidly decide that the adults have the better end of this deal they get potty treats not the baby within week or two she will be on board with the program letting off the pressure is great advice she may even feel like she failing op by not having it down yet babysat kid once in that situation did know it at the time just knew they were trying to potty train again did work out the first time encouraged him to go before bed he sat on there for ever probably good hour and peed and pooped in the toilet went to bed parents came home reported they were shocked in shaming and it feels terrible to not live up to expectations failing again and again she tried ugly clothes shaming sleeping in the bathtub since it right by the toilet but it backfired because it so going to the dump and no the garbage truck is going to bring it back as far as potty training goes he knows how he just does want to stop doing what he doing to go to the bathroom blame daycare they requested pull ups diapers because they did want to deal with his accidents he had two he wo use the potty at daycare he does okay at home it their fault they can retrain him did my week of potty training boot camp and it worked my son is in cloth both me and his dad were terrible potty trainers this provides hope normally would agree sweets and chocolate are most definitely treat in my house my 17mth old has never tried them but sometimes you have to throw the rules out of the window and do whatever works if giving her sweets for couple of days to get her on the toilet works then go for it it not guarantee our son was nearly was physically growing out of his cloth diapers and was still super resistant to potty training totally agree with this on sort of related note the escalation is referred to as extinction in dog training basically dogs or in this case kids will perform whatever bad behavior more and more loudly dramatically in an attempt to get what they want dog crying kid throwing tantrum it gets worse and worse until they finally give up and stop extinction of the bad behavior whenever my kid or dog escalates tell myself that good thing they re getting closer and closer to extinction yay find if look at it positively like that it helps keep me calm what has worked for us is going commando for the first week or so because underwear feel snug like diapers so some kids tend to use them that way at first plus without the underwear she ll really feel that unpleasant sensation of pee dripping down her leg also we figured out that our kid really just wanted privacy he could do it with me all up in his business so stopped prompting him unless it been more than 30 min or we re about to leave the house leave the bathroom light on now and he goes in there on his own to pee he was reluctant to poop in the potty at first he dance around the house amp try several times out success and then say his tummy hurt the first couple days it mostly ended up on the floor but once left him alone amp gave him privacy he did fine we ditched all the diapers at one time and took on night training along with day training so there are no mixed messages he sleeps in his pjs but no underwear we wake him up at about 11pm to pee on the potty amp he goes back to sleep this technique is from the book oh crap potty training which downloaded for about 11 and it has worked wonders for us highly recommend it as for the loud flushing my kid was afraid of public restrooms for so long because of that so we avoided them and changed his diapers in the car when he was getting closer to potty training we started taking him into public restrooms with us anyway as sort of exposure therapy because was tired of holding it when needed to go he cried but tried to ignore it and show him that was calm amp we were not in danger when he was old enough to understand taught him how to cover his ears while used the hand dryer it slow going process but eventually kids get over their fears when they see that it just normal part of everyday life good luck to you and your little lady my youngest just turned last month and only day trained about two weeks ago she knew what to do and when to do it but absolutely refused to train finally just sat down with her and askes her why she did want to use the potty she said she was worried about having to go to school once she used the potty once reassured her that we were going to shove her out the door the second she used the potty and got her her own pair of panties and we ve been day trained still diaper at night because she sleeps too deep still and never wakes up to go she just sleeps to deep have not been in your situation so maybe completely wrong but feel that this point is important it is her body we spend so much time encouraging our kids to be in touch with their feelings and bodies not to eat when not hungry go read book when feeling socially overwhelmed etc why not just respect her wishes in this personal instance in 20 years no one will remember the exact date she went to the toilet by herself but she will remember feeling ashamed and exposed by being made to pee her pants even though she cried and begged for diaper many people suggest not offering diapers any more but is that just setting her up to feel ashamed and insufficient she does not want to pee herself so why make her she is already able to tell beforehand would praise her for that first step and encourage her to decide for herself how she goes about her business at this point guess it safe to say that she knows exactly what you want her to do and how important this is to you yet she chooses to go the baby route am certain that she has reason and until you know what it is would just let her be there are so many other more relevant power struggles brushing teeth wearing sunscreen bike helmet save both of your energies for those that not crazy it pretty genius if you ask me have you ruled out medical issues bladder pevic muscles blockages etc just being thorough here gt ll leave her diaperless and she will eventually scream like crazy to have diaper because the pee pee is coming out at this point do you put her on the toilet or get her diaper stop buying diapers amp buy 10 packs of underwear yes realize 50ish pair of underwear seem excessive but if she as stubborn as you say you re in for lot of accidents amp clean ups just tell her shes big girl now no more baby diapers amp hand her her packs of panties when she has an accident let her change her clothes amp have her clean up the floor you ll probably have to have you hands full understand the the difficulty you are having and will tell you almost all of the ideas people have giving you are not great way to go about this my son has forced me to learn and understand the difficulty that children have are can not all be dealt with the same way when my son was noticed when he got upset even over little things it seemed to be the end of the world the screaming and crying would go for hours over something that should have lasted only minutes noticed autism vidieo and watched videos and said this is my son but my wife refused to admit he could have problem like that so let go by age it was starting to look like he had adhd like his oldest half brother same mom by it was looking much more defined by was sure there was no doubt by once again wife buts in says they cant test him till hes at least well wrong again wife the can test at 4yr so at he was tested and we found he was adhd and mild autism his is mainly social difficult handle loud noises talking about one subject for hours problems dealing with his emotions when upset crying and screaming over simple thing even at age hitting his head when he got mad in kindergarten he had what is called melt down where he losses all capability of controlling his emotions and it would last up to an hour in school setting this would happen time in hr setting at home the wife would say hes just acting spoiled well 1st grade came and that when it was by no means unnoticeable there where behavioral problems with self control the melt down where up to time week at least one day in class and his focuses was very limited about 20min of hr class day did he pay attention around 15 of day and yes he rated the lowest his class with most kids at 50 75 of the day once was final able to get diagonals it was able to start to understand why he acted in such ways the more learned about how he processes things the more realized where it came from me had such hard time in school by the time graduated want to never ever ever go back to school because they never understood what problem had and how to help me the normal yelling to stop his actions running through the house jumping off the furniture throwing balls spankings taking things away corner time that to him is the end of the world even at age he would cry for 1hr for being sent there 7mins sending him to bed never worked because they process thing different then normal kids so you have to teach them differently my son by no means looks autistic or would at first glace be thought of as such he super smart can see and notices thing almost nobody caches just like dad likes to talk about things that he enjoys and has good grades now that he is in 2nd grade and 2yr has medication for the adhd and is going to center that teaches kids like him how to socialize properly he has had great year only melt down this hole year last year was at least day in school just by understanding him and how to teach him how and why he should only do certain things has gone long way the school is amazed at how much of change has happened in only one year after we started treatment so you say that your child screams to have diaper and holds it till she is about to burst send huge signals that shes not like every kid and everything you try will most likely not work would start by putting her back in diapers making an appointment with psychologists doctor asap reading and reviewing autistic type behavior to see if anything lines up with your child watch her closely on how she act in different setting and maybe even taking note on how she handle different things such as injury overreacting over scratch noises different sounds in pitch lights brightness different sounds at higher levels how she play with toys such as throwing them when mad or hitting them trying to force thing that do fit all these types of things cant help lead to understanding why she dose not want to use toilet realistically sounds like anxiety by trying to force potty training she may now see it as stresser but hard for me to say do know there are children that go till there teens before they can cope with using toilet similar to such issues as people how cant use public toilets hope this opens you eyes to do your research and do wastes your time with general doctor they will just give you bs answer any way good luck and let me know how it works out
